main event: A bright, tail-shaped object was observed falling straight down and a smaller circular object with a flashing light accompanied it. The object then split into two parts, with the second part falling with a comet-like tail.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a meteor, but the Air Force reported it as an unidentified flying object (UFO).
The report included multiple sightings of the object, including one from a driver who saw it hovering in the sky and then ascend rapidly and disappear.
The object was described as bluish-green and then appearing brilliant white as it ascended and cleared the atmosphere.
The report mentions that the object may have been part of a meteorological shower originating in the New Orleans, Arkansas, and surrounding area.
The report includes details from a witness who saw the object descend and then split into two parts, with the second part falling with a comet-like tail.
sighted object: a bright, tail-shaped object and a smaller circular object with a flashing light
witnesses: multiple observers, including a driver and Coast Guard personnel
